venice.hub

Class DiskWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.hub.VeniceWriter
      • venice.hub.DiskWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DiskWriter
extends VeniceWriter
    Writes compressed data to disk.

    Opens a log file, getting the file name from Configuration. If a file with that name already exists the name will be changed.
    For example: If log.xio.gz already exists, it will be changed to log_001.xio.gz. If that exists too, it will be changed to log_002.xio.gz, and so on.

    The data will be converted to XIO lines.
    A header will be written in the beginning.
    The data will be compressed with GZIP, if configured so in Configuration.

    See Also:
    VeniceWriter

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Description copied from class: VeniceWriter
        Prepare everything needed to write to target. Will be called by the constructor, so an implementing class should not override the constructor.

        For example: A disk writer has to open file. A net writer has to create slots, and so on.

        Overrides:
        initialize in class VeniceWriter

      • write

        protected long write(venice.lib.parser.SlotEvent se)
        Description copied from class: VeniceWriter
        Writes a TTE object to target.
        Overrides:
        write in class VeniceWriter
        Returns:
        long The time (in milliseconds), when the TTE was written to the target.

      • cleanUp

        protected void cleanUp()
        Description copied from class: VeniceWriter
        Clean up, so the Thread can end safely.

        For example: A disk writer has to close the file.

        cleanUp in class VeniceWriter
